Hello Anuro, IP  are basically used by the router that means if two node are in different network they have to communicate with  IP address and IP help them to understand which network they have to communicate with .Once packet reaches to intended router, ARP (address resolution  protocol) translate the IP addr to MAC and switch send the packet to the receiver having that MAC addr. So if node are in same network then no need for ip addr ,MAC will be enough. It would be more clear in subsequent class.
